intro: Brachystelma mafekingense, commonly known as the Mafeking ice plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Aizoaceae family. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Northern Cape province, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and white. It is well adapted to arid environments and is often found growing on rock faces or in crevices. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
